member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnClick
member.summary: The onclick event occurs when the pointing device button is clicked over an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnDoubleClick
member.summary: The ondblclick event occurs when the pointing device button is double clicked over an element. This attribute may be used with most elements

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnMouseDown
member.summary: The onmousedown event occurs when the pointing device button is pressed over an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnMouseUp
member.summary: The onmouseup event occurs when the pointing device button is released over an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.lIII1I11II
member.summary: The onmouseover event occurs when the pointing device is moved onto an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnMouseMove
member.summary: The onmousemove event occurs when the pointing device is moved while it is over an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.lIII1I1Ill
member.summary: The onmouseout event occurs when the pointing device is moved away from an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnFocus
member.summary: The onfocus event occurs when an element receives focus either by the pointing device or by tabbing navigation. This attribute may be used with the following elements: A, AREA, LABEL, INPUT, SELECT, TEXTAREA, and BUTTON.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.lIII1I1Il1
member.summary: The onblur event occurs when an element loses focus either by the pointing device or by tabbing navigation. It may be used with the same elements as onfocus.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnKeyPress
member.summary: The onkeypress event occurs when a key is pressed and released over an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnKeyDown
member.summary: The onkeydown event occurs when a key is pressed down over an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnKeyUp
member.summary: The onkeyup event occurs when a key is released over an element. This attribute may be used with most elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnSelect
member.summary: The onselect event occurs when a user selects some text in a text fieldPath. This attribute may be used with the INPUT and TEXTAREA elements.

member.name: P:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII11I1IIl.OnChange
member.summary: The onchange event occurs when a control loses the input focus and its value has been modified since gaining focus. This attribute applies to the following elements: INPUT, SELECT, and TEXTAREA.

member.name: M:Nevron.ThinWeb.l1l111lllI1.IsHttpHandlerRegistered(Nevron.ThinWeb.NAspNetThinWebControl,System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction)
member.summary: Tests if an HTTP handler is registered in the web.config file under the configuration section system.web/httpHandlers.
member.param: The HTTP handler to test upon.
member.returns: True if the HTTP handler is registered, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Nevron.ThinWeb.l1l111lllI1.l1l111IlI1I(Nevron.ThinWeb.NAspNetThinWebControl,System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction)
member.summary: Registers an HTTP handler is the web.config file under the configuration section system.web/httpHandlers.
member.returns: True if the HTTP handler was registered successfully, false if the method fails to obtain an IWebApplication object from the site of the page or fails to obtain a Configuration object from the web application.
member.remarks: Does not check if the handler has been already registered. Please use the IsHttpHandlerRegistered method of the NClientServerTechnology class to determine if the HTTP handler exists in the web.config file.

member.name: M:Nevron.ThinWeb.l1l111lllI1.IsHttpHandlerRegisteredIIS7(Nevron.ThinWeb.NAspNetThinWebControl,System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction)
member.summary: Tests if an HTTP handler is registered in the web.config file under the configuration section system.webServer/handlers.
member.param: The HTTP handler to test upon.
member.returns: True if the HTTP handler is registered, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Nevron.ThinWeb.l1l111lllI1.l1l111IlIIl(Nevron.ThinWeb.NAspNetThinWebControl,System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction)
member.summary: Registers an HTTP handler is the web.config file under the configuration section system.webServer/handlers.
member.returns: True if the HTTP handler was registered successfully, false if the method fails to obtain an IWebApplication object from the site of the page or fails to obtain a Configuration object from the web application.
member.remarks: Does not check if the handler has been already registered. Please use the IsHttpHandlerRegisteredIIS7 method of the NClientServerTechnology class to determine if the HTTP handler exists in the web.config file.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11IllI
member.summary: .ui-widget: Class to be applied on outer container of all widgets. Applies font family and font size to widget. Also applies same family and 1em font size to child form elements specifically, to combat inheritance issues in Win browsers.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11Il1l
member.summary: .ui-widget-header: Class to be applied to header containers. Applies header container styles to an element and its child text, links, and icons.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11Il11
member.summary: .ui-widget-content: Class to be applied to content containers. Applies content container styles to an element and its child text, links, and icons. (can be applied to parent or sibling of header)

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.StateDefault
member.summary: .ui-state-default: Class to be applied to clickable button-like elements. Applies "clickable default" container styles to an element and its child text, links, and icons.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.StateHover
member.summary: .ui-state-hover: Class to be applied on mouseover to clickable button-like elements. Applies "clickable hover" container styles to an element and its child text, links, and icons.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11IlII
member.summary: .ui-state-active: Class to be applied on mousedown to clickable button-like elements. Applies "clickable active" container styles to an element and its child text, links, and icons.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11I1lI
member.summary: .ui-state-highlight: Class to be applied to highlighted or selected elements. Applies "highlight" container styles to an element and its child text, links, and icons.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11I11l
member.summary: .ui-state-error: Class to be applied to error messaging container elements. Applies "error" container styles to an element and its child text, links, and icons.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11I111
member.summary: .ui-state-error-text: An additional class that applies just the error text color without background. Can be used on form labels for instance. Also applies error icon color to child icons.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.StateDisabled
member.summary: .ui-state-disabled: Applies a dimmed opacity to disabled UI elements. Meant to be added in addition to an already-styled element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11I1Il
member.summary: .ui-priority-primary: Class to be applied to a priority-1 button in situations where button hierarchy is needed. Applies bold text.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11I1I1
member.summary: .ui-priority-secondary: Class to be applied to a priority-2 button in situations where button hierarchy is needed. Applies normal weight text and slight transparency to element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.Icon
member.summary: .ui-icon: Base class to be applied to an icon element. Sets dimensions to 16px square block, hides inner text, sets background itemPreview to "content" state sprite itemPreview. Note: .ui-icon class will be given a different sprite background itemPreview depending on its parent container. For example, a ui-icon element within a ui-state-default container will get colored according to the ui-state-default's icon color.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11IIl1
member.summary: .ui-corner-tl: Applies corner-radius to top left corner of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11IIlI
member.summary: .ui-corner-tl: Applies corner-radius to top left corner of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11II1l
member.summary: .ui-corner-bl: Applies corner-radius to bottom left corner of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11II11
member.summary: .ui-corner-br: Applies corner-radius to bottom right corner of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11II1I
member.summary: .ui-corner-top: Applies corner-radius to both top corners of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11IIIl
member.summary: .ui-corner-bottom: Applies corner-radius to both bottom corners of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11III1
member.summary: .ui-corner-right: Applies corner-radius to both right corners of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII11IIII
member.summary: .ui-corner-left: Applies corner-radius to both left corners of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII1Illll
member.summary: .ui-corner-all: Applies corner-radius to all corners of element.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII1Illl1
member.summary: .ui-widget-overlay: Applies 100% wxh dimensions to an overlay screen, along with background color/texture, and screen opacity.

member.name: F:Nevron.SPVision.Design.lII1I1IIIl.lIII1IlllI
member.summary: .ui-widget-shadow: Class to be applied to overlay widget shadow elements. Applies background color/texture, custom corner radius, opacity, top/left offsets and shadow "thickness". Thickness is applied via padding to all sides of a shadow that is set to match the dimensions of the overlay element. Offsets are applied via top and left margins (can be positive or negative).
